Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov2

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, MultiInfoCalculator, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov2
extends MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov

    Computes the differential multi-information of two given multivariate sets of observations (implementing MultiInfoCalculator), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see Kraskov et al., below), algorithm 2. Most of the functionality is defined by the parent class MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MultiInfoCalculator, and expanded on in MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov.

    References:

    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    TODO should use the kthMinIndices code from MatrixUtils as per MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • partialComputeFromObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromObservations​(int startTimePoint,
                                                  int numTimePoints,
                                                  boolean returnLocals)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data.

        The method returns:

        1. for average Multi-infos (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_x+1) in each marginal for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local MIs (returnLocals == true), the array of local MI values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromObservations in class MultiInfoCalculatorKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of sum of digamma(n_x+1) for each marginal x, then sum of n_x for each marginal x (these latter ones are for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
